alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Interstate 5 Corridor; Santa Clarita Valley; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 31 at 9:19AM PDT until October 31 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 2 PM TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES DUE TO LOW HUMIDITIES AND GUSTY NORTHEAST WINDS... .Santa Ana wind gusts of 25 to 45 mph and humidities below 10 percent will continue critical fire weather conditions through this afternoon over portions of Los Angeles and Ventura Counties. While red flag weather conditions may continue past that through Wednesday, they should be more localized and less extreme. As such, there are NO immediate plans to extend this Red Flag Warning beyond the current 2 pm expiration. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WIND PRONE MOUNTAINS AND VALLEYS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... * WINDS...Northeast to east 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. Isolated gusts to 55 mph early. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity of 3 to 10 percent. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.
